My family took the subway to Oksu station last night, and were greatly disappointed with the barren landscape of the so-called Hangang Park. The stretch of the Hangang Park we walked along from Oksu to the next subway station was more of a parallel cycling & walking pathways, peppered with a couple of exercise & children playground. Rather poor representation of a park & nothing scenic about it. Perhaps there would be a bit more greenery & a better representation of a park.

I and my family just walk and enjoy during visiting this place,..the walking path, bike path are also very good.taking picture and the river being a background was beautiful.Do not forget to have noodles and enjoy a cup of coffee during relaxing and enjoy the spring.keep walking.
I can walk in the night, beautiful image there, clean water also the little fountain for some pictures

This is a long strech so I suggest choose a specific location. 63 building has a nice park where you can take a cruise or enjoy a bicycle or simply take a stroll. They also have j bug park and part with floating islands which until now is still closed.
Would love to lay a mat, open a bottle of wine on the grass patch and enjoy the buskers performance on a cold autumn night.
I've been so lucky to be in Seoul during the lantern festival and it has been a treat. In the night all this colourful walk ( little chilly but charming), we were all excited like children.. great

If u feel boring and wanna get out, u can bring mat ,pillow,beer and dont forget plastic bag and tissue, in 7-midnight, get the perfect place than sit there , i want to share my experience drink end enjoy river than sleep there ,i try thats once time, my korea. Friends suggest me sleep there, first time i just thing its a crazy thing sleep outside,especially public space,in the case in my country no ones sleep it out in public space especially a woman, but in korea is safer , i also put my ipad and mobile phone and no ones taking in, u should try is drink till sleep there and see sunrise , Amazing!!! Cool experience !!

review_title: Best and easiest place to get away from the city for a little bit.
review_body: The Hangang banks have been transformed over the past few years and there are great walking paths, benches to sit on and outdoor exercise facilities for anyone. There are bike rental locations and fountains to watch. A great place to get away from the city a bit while still being in the city.

review_title: Watch old people work out like beasts lol
review_body: The great thing about Hangang Park is that there are a million ways to get there because it travels throughout Seoul. The first time I went there, I was actually wandering and had gotten lost and ended up by one of the entrances. It's a great place for walking and exercise, as well as other activities, but my title says it all haha: the elderly in Korea are serious about their work outs! It's quite inspiring for a young, lazy person as myself, who drives everywhere. Anyhow, my second time here was for the annual fireworks show. The place was packed! I think it's necessary that everyone who goes to Seoul, go to Hangang, just because it's "The Han."

The transformation of Seoul is the most noticeable around Hangang Park. There are bike trails, hiking trails, and picnic area next to the river. There are 10 or 11 bridges on Hangang River connecting Seoul to other cities.

review_title: Enjoy the sunny breeze and relax by the Han river
review_body: Went on a Sunny but cool day, with the comforting cool breeze it is a perfect place for you to chill out the whole day, perhaps throw a baseball around with your friend. Lots of locals around and feel free to take a river cruise to see the beautiful scenery of the Han River
yup! when you get tired after walking so many miles.. go to hangang park! you can see around and relax.. ah! i just experienced it!

For me, this is a must in Seoul. Many people, families, couples, and tourists came here for many activities. I rent a bike for a good ride in the park. And if it was warmer, I could have rent a tent for a picnic. The scene of the river was beautiful. And by the night time come, lights’ reflection on the water made the park a very romantic scene. Many couples would be around at this time of the day, so don’t just go there alone.

review_title: Stroll along the Han River or Bike if you like?
review_body: Personally, i like to go here in the fall when its not so crowded during the week, the weekends is always a popular place for everyone to gather. There are miles and miles of bike trails and if you are into biking than this is the place for you, bike rental places are all over the place and you can rent by the hour and time flies when you start to bike along the river. If you prefer to walk there are alot of trails that take you close to the river and great place for couples to take pictures and families to bring a mat and have a picnic. Its relaxing and enjoyable but spring and summer are really crowded so pick and choose the time to go. I have never been at night so i dont know how it changes but during the day until sunset is a great place for a place to chill and take a breather!!

Way to kill the romantic night strolls with drunks lying and stumbling around, reeking with cheap alcohol. The night view is good, however, the day would be better with more activities and sober people.

review_title: First cycling trip along the Han River
review_body: I am a keen cyclist and wanted to see a different side to Seoul / Korea from that I normally experience. I found a shop with high quality road bikes to rent (Ritte / Shimano Groupset / Reynolds carbon fibre wheels) and headed off. Getting to the cycle paths by the river felt a bit hazardous and was not much fun, but once you are on them it is safe and relatively flat. The first day I cycled from Seoul to Yangpyeong and back,the second day up to Bukhansan National Park. I particularly enjoyed the old railways paths. In the confines of the park in Seoul there is plenty to see and do, but the paths are also quite busy with other bike users and pedestrians, not all of whom appear to have much awareness of other path users- you need to keep your wits about you. As you head out there are plenty of restaurants / stalls to keep up hydration and energy levelsand people very friendly. All in all, it was a great experience, that I have no hesitation recommending.
This is a lovely park that has stunning views of the Han River. Bring your mat, pad, or tent to relax out on the rolling grass hills.

Nice place to hangout with either friends or family. It's best to come here on weekdays as it might be too crowded on weekends.Bike rental will cost you about 3000won per hour. My friends and i went there at about 12 in the afternoon, and surprisingly there were quite a number of people at hangang park (jogging, cycling, etc...). Anyhoo, if cycling is not your thing, you can stroll around or even ride cruises.

My husband and I love this park! We rented a tandem bike for $6,000 won per hour and rode along the Hangang River. It was a great way to see the city and give our exhausted feet a rest. A plus is that the back person on the tandem bike can also take photos! The rental bike shop if off the Bundang Line, exit 2 (note that this line may not be in the old metro map). There are gardens, outside gyms, volleyball courts, bat mitten nets, a rock climbing wall facility, a roller skate park, and convenient stores along the bike path. We enjoyed the breeze, watching the locals, and stopping along the way to soak in the scenery. Highly recommended!!! Even if you don't like biking, I would recommend that you check out the park for its facilities (fountains, playgrounds, deer zoo, etc).

Hangang Park is crowded during weekends especially Sunday afternoon. A good place for family outing and picnic. Beautiful place for cycling too. Hangang Park is less than 5 minutes walk away from Yeouido Church and a minute walk to the subway station.Read more on my blog.http://loveanqila.blogspot.sg/2013/08/travelogue-yeouido-hangang-park.html

You can rent bikes and ride the trail up or downstream.... it's a perfect place for a picnic, or great stretch of green for a friendly game. The backdrop of the city across the river also make a great spot for taking photos

We went primarily to do a boat cruise - which we did and thoroughly enjoyed the 1 hr return trip, great fun and highly recommended! But the park area is lovely! Clean beautiful space that goes for miles by the river Busy with cyclists picnics and loads of people chilling out! Lots of eating and drinking options and bike hire if feeling energetic! My son who is 7 loved it and had a ball playing in a great playground with Korean kids who made him really welcome despite no EnglishGreat fun place

Bike rental were available at 3,000 Won per hour. Cheap and good. Loads of kids and elderly having picnic and playing water by the river. It would be better at weekend night with light shows and fountain performance.

An awesome place to go when you want to just relax from the busy life of Seoul. Great place for all travelers, whether you go as couples, family, friends, solo, or even business people. Just sit down and relax while watching the water, and maybe order something to eat while you're at it. Take a moment to enjoy the scenery and relax, or maybe go take a walk along the river. It's a safe place for families with younger children to just let them go and run around. But remember to come back after the sun sets too (but it may be a bit crowded as more people come). This place is just amazing at night and has the perfect atmosphere for every occasion. So take a short break from your traveling and just take a seat.

review_title: Have a rest and simply chill
review_body: Hangang Park is simply so big that you see different happenings and people when you visit a different stretch of the long winding road along the river. During the evening you can see tons of locals either coming to Hangang to cycle or simply chill while admiring the beautiful river at night. Not to mention the tons of flyers advertising fried chicken and pizza given out once one exits the closest station to the river : Yeouinaru station. Went there thrice in total - Had fried chicken with friends sitting on the boardwalk along the river on my first time. That's the area where most people simply eat and chill, with the occasional busker playing and singing along to a nice little ditty. Had fried chicken again on my second visit, but this time monsoon season had struck and the river bank apparently was overflooded. The boardwalk now had disappeared and police patrols were advising civilians to go back home. Still had a great time though. Landed up at the cycling path of the river on my final visit, arrived from the bridge connecting Seoul Forest to the park. Tons of cycling enthusiasts and people jogging along the path at night. A definite must visit for travellers and tourists. If you have a penchant for beautiful sceneries and simply hanging out.

review_title: just a park next to the river
review_body: the lane for cyclist, jogger is a bit narrow and the space for picnickers is limited. Good thing is it's not crowded and they provide food delivery in the park!

review_title: perfect for a walk or jog
review_body: This park is great if you enjoy walking or jogging. It gets crowded in the evening with everyone coming here to walk their dog, or for dates to see the Banpo bridge rainbow. There are also no places to rent a bike, or even sit in the shade, but it's a pleasant park, very clean, there is exercising equipment, and you can walk/jog/bike a decent distance without going in circles.
The hangang park is beautifully made and is extremely clean and well maintained. It has a lot of people cycling around and strolling to enjoy the evening.
The park is more romantic with the lights at night. You can have a picnic or ride a bike while you're there.
Rent a bicycle for a great ride. The water is brown, but the people are bustling with energy, and you get a sense that the park was designed for enjoyment for all.

a lovely place for walking & visiting at first introduce with Korea (Seoul). There are a lot of interesting sights at park such as Banpo bridge, floating island, cruise trip along the river Hangang & so on.
We were lucky to be at Hangang Park when the cherry trees were in bloom. A beautiful spring day with people riding tahndem bicycles and rollerblading.

I walked along here both at night and during the day with my husband. At nighttime it was nice to see all the Korean couples holding hands (Koreans seem more romantic than Americans, constantly holding hands but never making out) walking along the trail, and during the day it was nice to see school groups.

review_title: A place to relax and exercise ^^
review_body: I came here almost every night with my friends during our 3 week stay in Seoul. In the morning, you get to see downtown Seoul across the Han River and just relax in under the sun. In the evening, there's a few live performances (we walked into a live rock concert!) families and friends exercising (outdoor gym equipment (free) & bikes for rental) It's walking distance from the metro station, 63 building, lots of street food carts, and local cafes.

review_title: Wonderful place to walk or run along HAN river
review_body: The park was very clean and the walkways level and even for runners / bikers. They had separate sidewalks for pedestrians. At points, there were fountains and water features and other whimsical art works for children.. It stretched for miles along the waterfront.

This is a beautiful stretch of bike and walking trails along the Han River. You will see everything from the 63 (tallest building) to the colorful trees (spring) while you ride or run the path. Luckily this is where we choose to do out Semi-Annual Physical Fitness Test... WAY better than a track!!

The Han river stretches far and really wide at some parts.it is quite picturesque with a number of bridges spanning from one side of seoul to the other part.We went to the hangang park in yeouido..but,when taking the subway,stop at yeuoinaru.read and follow the exit signs for yeouido park.the park is just out by the exit.there is a cart selling drinks,snacks and worms(?) boiling in 2 huge pots.There are actually a number of parks,but,we chose yeouido for it's close proximity to the subway exit.for some parks,you have to walk from the exit to get to the park.It is beautiful..vast and wide..with the cityscape of seoul across ,and, also behind you.we got there around 4pm on a weekday in very early springtime..it was chilly and there were a few groups around.it was peaceful and just amazing.There's a Public toilet accessible by ramp,a small playground, benches, and shops where you can rent bikes from around 6000won to around 10000won per hour.there are kiddie bikes with trainer wheels,junior sized bikes, bikes for adults and tandem bikes. The bike shop is just right beside the mini playground.they will ask you to leave some identification if you want to get a bike.From where we were we counted 6 bridges that we can easily see.I would suggest this stop on your second trip to seoul, or on your first if you are staying long enough to make this stop without hurrying things up.This stop best taken slow and easy.

I went here at night, to see Banpo bridge rainbow show.There were many local people doing exercised here, or just hanging out with friends. At noon some local picnic here.The rainbow show only 15 minutes, but it was beautiful.Even I can see it when I still ride subway on the way to the bridge.One tourist attraction must see at Seoul.

Park runs alongside the river in Seoul. In parts there are busy roads which also run alongside the river but the park is wide enough particularly on the south side that the road noise does not disturb. Great place to watch seoulites take their exercise and enjoy themselves- day or night. Several little snack places and shops in the park. Those on the south side are floating structures for when the river floods.

We went here during winter when they convert the swimming pool to a snow sled area.Good for both kids and adult to enjoy sledding and playing with snow if you dont have time to go to the ski resorts. Walking distance from the train station Ttukseom Resort
Cycle tracks on both sides of the river take you from one end of the city to the other. There are also extensive cycle tracks along various smaller rivers.

Last day in Korea,I planed to go Han river for an annual fireworks festival that started 7.00 PM but I came too early and no have time for keep waiting this show.....what a shame TT..... There're a lot of people from all around the city came here to see the fireworks.So I was only just riding bicycle along the river....such a best moment EVER!

This park is by the banks of the Hangang(Han River).Meticulously clean and safe, most parts of Seoul are low-crime areas, if not zero crime including this park.Even if you walk late at night, you feel safe strolling in the park.

if you are looking for something out of normal trip,come to this banpo hangang park and watch the bridge become rainbowly color with music being played out.the show time could be vary and remember to do some homework before you come,the show will be cancel if raining.if you come here before sunset,you can walk around and it is a good place for exercise as well as photo session. the show take places about 20minutes.

Walked going to the park from MBC. being alone I was not impressed really, it's just a riverside park. Maybe If I have the time I may rent a bike and just enjoy the cool river breeze. I guess the views at night is great. May take the cruise next time from the park.

This is a nice park where you can chill, hire a bicycle catch good views of the Han river, and you can catch a cruise day or even better, by night, from here. Cruises have live shows as well as going past the Banpo Bridge for its evening water and light display.

review_title: Nice, lots of locals jogging and hanging out.
review_body: Lovely to visit, take a slow stroll along the river to just destress or relax. You will find that there are many locals jogging in the park or just simply sitting around on mats and chatting, having a picnic etc.

review_title: Nice Place to Ride a Bike
review_body: Several places to rent Bicycles by the hour along the River. Many places to stop and grab a snack or just rest and take in the views.

Beautiful park and nice to walk around, enjoy the nice weather and view.You can rent bicycles too, but we did not do so as we did not have enough time as we took the cruise.We were there last week from Noryangin Market. We took a taxi to Hanggang Park that cost less than KRW5,000. We were there at around 5pm and took the cruise to view 8pm rainbow banpo bridge. Recomend for everyone who visit Seoul.The subway with elevator is just across the road from where the cruise is.
Great area to do some sports.. Like a walk, bicycle, jog or just a picnic by the Han river. A bit far from subway station tho...

review_title: Great place if you love jogging and walking!
review_body: If you like jogging this could be the place where to go while you are staying in Seoul. It is a 10km long path along the river. You can hear the traffic in the street but it is fine. The river allows for a nice view of Seoul.

review_title: Biking in Hangang Park -kids and adults
review_body: Come here if you are a biking enthusiast. Fantastic trail for biking. For kid, there is a Bike centre where your child can bike in an enclosure, trying variations of bikes. Tip: Long walk (25mins) from the nearest subway. Much better to go by the route past the shops then highway. Come only if you have time to spare, otherwise, a kid would prefer Lotte World

we went there at night to catch the bridge glimpse ..banpo bridge with golden fountain ( check the show schedule)... i thinks its start around 4pm, with 2 hours interval).. Enjoying the park and walk along the river is very relaxing. the breathtaking river view ..we stay there until midnight....along with bunch of people ..really have a good time

review_title: My Favorite Place in the World!
review_body: Rent or borrow a bike and use the bike paths of Hangang Park to visit other places, think of it as the arterial system of the city, as many of the tributaries also have bike paths. One can bike the to the far reaches of the Seoul suburbs. If there is a river near an attraction, it is very likely you can use the paths to get there, the network has several hundred Km of paths. .The park itself is has 12 individual parks that range from Ancient tombs, to windsurfing and munificent modern art. Moreover, one can see Koreans using their little leisure time to enjoy themselves. From Unification church women doing traditional fan dances, to old men playing paduk, to some excellent music at one of the many performance areas. I lived in Seoul for three years, and this is my favorite place in the world One can really experience Seoul at this park
The whole cycling path is impressed. The have spent so much time building the whole park and everyone get to enjoy the view of Han's river as well as relax along the river. Good job!

Can spend an entire day out here. Hire bicycles and ride along the river. Very good cycle track. Lots of places to stop at and lots of places to eat at along the way. Could even spend some time at the pools that are available in the summer season. A must see

review_title: ~Nice place to spend a relaxing few hours!!!
review_body: ~We spent a lovely afternoon here. We took an hour cruise down the Han River. Not much to see on the river but it was relaxing. We also took the swan boat out for 40 minutes (the kids enjoyed that). You can cycle, have a picnic, eat at one of the restaurants (the fried chicken at the swan rental place smelt good..LOL). Many photo ops with the statues and the Seoul skyline in the distance.

review_title: Love the running, walking, cycling trails
review_body: Can be a bit crowded on weekends. Be careful of cyclists if u r a walker or runner. Be careful of walkers or runners if u r a cyclist.Great way to relax anytime of the dayLong trails. Can easily spend hours along the river

One of our hosts took me for a walk along the river and a boat cruise. It was quite pleasant, with paths for both pedestrians and cyclists, of whom there were many despite it being the middle of a week day. Small stores every so often selling drinks and snacks. Some of the locals were setting up tents for shade (not many trees). I'm told families will come there and call one of the local restaurants on their cell phones and the restaurant will deliver. Enjoyed a glass of citrus tea (tasted like sweetened marmalade) while waiting for the boat cruise. The hostess on the boat spoke in Korean and then put on recordings for English and, I believe Chinese, the time I was there--I assume other languages were available as well.

review_title: A relaxing break from city life!
review_body: I was visiting in Seoul and was taken to Banpo park to enjoy a picnic and the water display with lights off the bridge. It was a lovely evening-- music playing, families, couples, friends, enjoying the great weather and the show of the water and colored lights off the bridge with the city of Seoul in the background. I highly recommend it!

Sadly this is what Koreans mostly call a park. Okay, its next to the river, it has some patches of grass, but almost no trees and is mostly concrete. Also, the river cruises which take off from here are very user unfriendly.

Fantastic series of parks along the Han River - hire a bike for 3000Won for an hour and ride along any of these parks to escape some of the hustle. Good landscaping has made these parks very popular so you'll see Seoulites enjoying the urban outdoors, but there awe also many areas left to grow naturally.

Reached the park through Express Bus terminal station exit 8-1. I thought it the fountain show is 6pm but unfortunately was moved to 5pm. I was about 30 minutes late that time so I was not able to see the show. However, I did enjoy the view of the floating island and the people relaxing, exercising and biking at the park. Watched the sunset and then head home..Hope to catch the show next time..

I love seeing people enjoying the outdoors and excericising. Hangang Park really celebrates the river which is so central to the city. It is well used by locals - there is still so much of it I am yet to explore.

review_title: Great place for a run, bike or walk!
review_body: Hangang Park runs along with Han River and has a walking/bike path as well as lots of other things to see and do. It is a great place to take a walk or ride a bike (rentals available). I highly recommend it for anyone looking for something relaxing to do without the hustle and bustle of the city.
I would recommend this park, definitely. The view was absolutely breathtaking. Spend some time to sit at the park and enjoy the Hangang River too.

For a small fee you can purchase a blanket (more like that shiny thing you put in your car windows in the summer) to sit on and just relax. Lots of people and activity. Lots of artists performing on the streets when I was there.

In korea, every place is so beautiful. So as the hongang park. Hangang park exist in many place in seoul, just along the hangang(han river), if you are bored, go there walk for a while, bring some food to there for eat, is a kind of enjoyable.

review_title: Beautiful view at night all lit up from the room
review_body: Beautiful view at night all lit up from the room, unfotuantely i did not have time to visit even though i here they have a awesome resteraunt up top.

review_title: Try the night river cruise -it's so romantic
review_body: the fee is about krw14,000 (foreigner price). There's also some magic show inside the cruise. You can sit on the open air deck to observe Seoul's mesmerizing city view during night and see watershow (if lucky)--but avoid boarding during late autumn/winter (it's freezing!). You can also rent couple bike inside the park.

review_title: Except it is not open during off peak season!
review_body: I was here in November the previous year. Totally enjoyed it. It was a beautiful display, with music and all but we were disappointed to find out that they are not open during the off season such as March.

review_title: Nice to get away from the city
review_body: But, there is still a lot of traffic noise; the park is an afterthought from a river-front highway. The bike lanes are nice but crowded.
Its a nice place to walk or bike with friends and family. From here, you could see 63 building and hangang river. also can get to hangang cruise to refresh your mind with their sceneric park.

There are always a bunch of things happening around the Hangang River... hours of entertainment and happenings along this River... Camping sites, great for outdoor activities, biking along the river, Play baseball... the yearly fireworks festival... many music festivals...nightly cocktail cruises and a whole lot more has become home to the Hangang Park!

The Hanggang Park is a bikers haven. Whether you have your own bike or decides to rent in the many bike rental shops along the park, it is just mind blowing to see the Han River in it's majestic beauty by pedaling. Bike rentals offer regular (3,000W) to premium (6,000) type of bikes per hour plus an additional (500W) for every 15 minutes thereof. There are dedicated running and bike lanes that make it safe for both runners and bikers. There are also distance markers on the road that make it easier for bikers to see how far they have biked. The elevation is not too bad and is pretty alright for newbie bikers and requires minimal to no gear shifting at all. The shops also provide tandem bikes if riding in tandem is what you prefer. The Hanggang Park is very accessible by Seoul Metro Line 5.

review_title: Great parkland skirting the Han River to exercise and relax
review_body: I live nearby (+/- 1.5Km) from the Han River and I use this park to run in 3 to 4 times a week. It stretches for 30 - 40KMs along the river, with well established cycle and walking / running paths and on summer weekends it can get quite busy. Lots of exercise stations located in the park along the river with sports fields for a number of sports (soccer, Rugby, badmington etc). I belong to a running club that bases itself in the Ichon section of Hanggang Park and we run every Saturday morning a 5km and 10km course. Everyone is welcome to join us there. You can find our location where we meet at www.seoulflyers.com. We are one of many clubs that base their sporting activities in the Hangang Park.

review_title: Great for bicycle rides or walks
review_body: The path along the Hangang stretches for many kms so it's an excellent place to go for a long bicycle ride. However, if you do you'll know why so many of the people on bicycles have bandanas covering their face. The pollution is pretty bad. But this is one of the best places in Seoul to exercise away from cars. Also every so often you'll see outside gym machines that you can exercise on.

review_title: Fun & relaxation in the middle of Seoul
review_body: Perfect place to just go and relax or have fun with kids. It does not feel like you are in the middle of the city.
I have traveled to Seoul periodically over the last 8 years, to visit my son, who lives there. He and his buddies play American Football, and their usual venue is Hangang Park. A beautiful spot!
it is great to cycle along Hangang! Fresh air accompanies superb scenery of buildings as well as the river itself.
Great way to relax and get a little exercise at the same time

We arrived at the Banpo Hangang Park at about 6pm, 2 hours before the scheduled musical rainbow bridge show. A walk around the area is pretty relaxing. I would recommend this place for quality photo sessions.As the sun sets, the street lights are lit up along with the floating islands and the bridge, which is a beautiful sight. A lot of people does their evening exercises there. Ahjummas and ahjusshis brisk walking and there are bikers dressed in full gears cycling along the river. Some others would drop by in their working attire. I supposed, the came right after work.The Banpo part of Hangang Park is children friendly in the sense that there is a very big space for the children to run around. Do take a walk to the floating islands which are lit in technicolor. One of them has a restaurant upstairs where you can have a good view of the Banpo bridge.When the clock strikes 8, music started blaring from the speakers (which we could not find) and water was sprayed out of the undersides of the Banpo Bridge according to the rhythm. Really pretty.A great effort by the Seoul Government!

review_title: My favourite day in South Korea was cycling along the Han
review_body: Rent bikes, cross to the north bank of Mapo Bridge, cycle down the blue ramp, and find yourself on a pristine, flat cycle path running for miles alongside the beautiful Han river. We nodded cheerily at the locals cycling, walking, boating, fishing, playing competitive frisbee (complete with cheerleaders) and using the copious outdoor exercise equipment as we cycled along this serene, beautiful stretch of water in the heart of the city. A delight of an experience and my favourite activity in Seoul. (For further info, the Lonely Planet Korea guidebook describes this cycle.)

The Han River spans 500 plus kms and is 1km wide within the Seoul city limits. Along the banks of the river in Seoul, there are pedestrian walkways and bicycle paths on both sides. Various restaurants and cafes are located on these paths. Its a great recreation spot for locals and tourist. If you are a local you can even rent for free bicycles and its nice to cycle along the river and marvel at all the buildings on both sides.Its great place for exercise or just to pass the time. Suitable for people of all ages. You can also do some fishing or even ride a jet ski, if you have one that is. We cycled for like 9kms and spent around 3 hours. It was a nice experience.

We spent about an hour and a half on one afternoon just walking and playing along the Han river. It was a great place to run around--after sightseeing in Seoul, this was a great break. We found several playgrounds South/East of the river. It was fun to see what creative equipment Korean kids play on. There were even exercise machines on the playgrounds--my kids ages 7, 5, and 2 had a great time. The only downside--no real places to eat, so pack your own snacks and taxi to somewhere in Itaewon for dinner.

Basically...they will take you to cruise cross the bridges of Seoul...but nothing special with the bridges, only 1 bridge which has colorful lights (but absolutely not comparable with "symphony of lights" in HongkongQuite expensive too (went on 11Nov09, 8.10 PM Yeuido-Yeuido with 13,000 Won)
